intro: Conioselinum ingricum, commonly known as the roughleaf wormwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic properties. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow, rough, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Conioselinum ingricum is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
